senses.sense_definition: The quantity of people or things that a gig (a light two-wheeled carriage or a small boat) can hold.

examples.text: The farmer drove a <w>gigful</w> of fresh produce to the local market.
He transported a <w>gigful</w> of passengers across the bay in his small boat.

senses.sense_definition: The amount of material, such as songs, sufficient for a musical performance.

examples.text: The band rehearsed a <w>gigful</w> of new tracks before the tour started.
They needed to write a few more tunes to have a complete <w>gigful</w> for the night.
